name: featuretools.EntitySet.entity_from_dataframe
description: Load the data for a specified entity from a Pandas DataFrame. Create an EntitySet if it does not exist

args.name: entityset
args.description: EntitySet where the dataframe will be added.

entity_id.description: Unique id to associate with this entity

index.description: Name of the variable used to index the entity. If None, take the first column.

variable_types.description: Keys are of variable ids and values are variable types. Used to to initialize an entity’s store.

make_index.description: If True, assume index does not exist as a column in dataframe, and create a new column of that name using integers. Otherwise, assume index exists.

time_index.description: Name of the variable containing time data. Type must be in variables.DateTime or be able to be cast to datetime (e.g. str, float, or numeric.)

secondary_time_index.description: Name of variable containing time data to use a second time index for the entity.

already_sorted.description: If True, assumes that input dataframe is already sorted by time. Defaults to False.
